ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What is the research participant's HIV status as indicated in the clinical records or medical charts?
Notes: 1= HIV exposed; status indeterminate (for children/adolescents only); 2= HIV exposed, uninfected (for children/adolescents only); 3= Negative; 4= Positive; 5= Indeterminant; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What is your HIV Status (self-reported)?
Notes: 3= Negative; 4= Positive; 5= Indeterminant; 7= Refuse to answer; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What is the research participant's HIV status as determined from diagnostic biomarkers for HIV infection?
Notes: 1= HIV Exposed; status indeterminate (for children/adolescents only); 2= HIV exposed, uninfected (for children/adolescents only); 3= Negative; 4= Positive; 5= Indeterminant; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What measure was used to determine the HIV status as indicated in the clinical records or medical charts?
Notes: 1= Biological or clinical marker; 2= Self-report; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What year was the research participant first diagnosed with or tested positive for HIV?
Has the research participant ever used anti-HIV medicines, also called antiretroviral therapy (ART), to treat HIV?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Yes, but not currently; 2= Yes, currently; 7= Refuse to answer; 8= Not applicable; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What measure was used to determine antiretroviral therapy use by the research participant?
Notes: 1= Biomarker of ART use (e.g., hair antiretroviral concentrations); 2= Objective measure (e.g., medical monitoring, pharmacy refills); 3= Self-report measure (single or multiple items); 8= Not Applicable; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What year did the research participant first use antiretroviral medications, or antiretroviral therapy, to treat HIV?
Has the research participant ever used anti-HIV medications, also called Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP), to prevent HIV?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Yes, but not currently; 2= Yes, currently; 7= Refuse to answer; 8= Not applicable; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What measure was used to determine Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) use by the research participant?
Notes: 1= Biomarker of PrEP use (e.g., hair antiretroviral concentrations); 2= Objective measure (e.g., medical monitoring, pharmacy refills); 3= Self-report measure (single or multiple items); 8= Not Applicable; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What year did the research participant first use Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) to prevent HIV?
Have you ever had a CD4 count lower than 200 or been told that you had an opportunistic infection?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= I do not know

ElementDescription: In the past year, has your viral load always been undetectable?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 99= I do not know

ElementDescription: Have you heard of a long-acting shot for HIV treatment (For example, Cabenuva or Cabotegravir)?
If you have heard of a long-acting shot for HIV treatment, has your doctor offered you a long-acting shot as a treatment option for HIV?
What is the name of the HIV antiretroviral medication(s) you are currently taking?
In the past 30 days, have you experienced side effects from your HIV medication(s)?
What side effects have you experienced on your current HIV medications?
How bad are the side effects that you have experienced from you HIV medication in the past 30 days?
Notes: 1= Mild (doesn't impact daily activities); 2= Moderate (makes some daily activities difficult) ; 3= Severe (requires medical care)

ElementDescription: Are any of your HIV medications taken as pills?
How many pills do you take daily for HIV?
How many times a day do you take a dose of  HIV medications?
Notes: Number of times a day; 999 = Decline to answer

ElementDescription: In the last 30 days, on how many days did you miss at least one dose of any of your HIV medicines?
Do you usually get 30- or 90-day supplies of your HIV medications?
How do you usually get your HIV medication? (Check all that apply) The clinic or health department
How do you usually get your HIV medication? (Check all that apply) A pharmacy in community (CVS, Walgreens, etc.)
How do you usually get your HIV medication? (Check all that apply) Mailed to me
How do you usually get your HIV medication? (Check all that apply) Veterans Affairs (VA)
How do you usually get your HIV medication? (Check all that apply) Other
If OTHER, please specify other places you get your HIV medication.
In the past 12 months, have you ever run out of your HIV medications for more than 24 hours?
In the past 12 months, what was the longest amount of time you were out of any of your HIV medications?
Notes: 1= 1 day; 2= A few days; 3= 1 week; 4= 2 to 3 weeks; 5= 1 month or longer

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) I was out of town
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) Issues with my doctor's office or the prescription
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) Miscommunication with the pharmacy
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) I thought I had more pills than I did
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) Someone accidentally threw out my pills or they were lost
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) Too much going on
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) Cost too much
In the past 12 months, what were the reasons that your HIV medication ran out? (Check all that apply) Other
If OTHER, please specify other reasons that your HIV medication ran out.
Are any of your HIV medications given as a shot/injection?
In the past 12 months, have you received your injection late (more than a week after your original appointment) or missed your injection?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, received more than a week late; 2= Yes, missed completely

ElementDescription: What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) I was out of town
What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) Issues with my doctor's office or the prescription
What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) Not able to get transportation
What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) Too much going on
What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) Cost too much
What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) I forgot about my appointment
What were the main reasons that you received your injection late? (Check all that apply) Other
If OTHER, please specify other reasons that you received your injections late.
In the past 12 months, have you received case management services for HIV?
Do you receive case management in the same place you receive HIV care?
Do you currently have a usual place, like a doctor's office or clinic, where you go for most of your HIV health care?
Have you had to change HIV care providers in the past 12 months?
Why did you change HIV care providers in the past 12 months? (Check all that apply) Personal choice
Why did you change HIV care providers in the past 12 months? (Check all that apply) My provider quit or left
Why did you change HIV care providers in the past 12 months? (Check all that apply) My insurance changed
Why did you change HIV care providers in the past 12 months? (Check all that apply) I moved
Why did you change HIV care providers in the past 12 months? (Check all that apply) Other
If OTHER, please specify why you changed HIV care providers in the past 12 months.
In the past 12 months, including today, how often did you have a HIV health care appointment?
Notes: 0= I did not have any HIV health care appointment; 1= Once; 2= Twice; 3= 3 or more times

ElementDescription: In the past 12 months, what methods have you used to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) App or online portal (for example, MyChart)
In the past 12 months, what methods have you used to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Phone call
In the past 12 months, what methods have you used to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Text message
In the past 12 months, what methods have you used to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Email
In the past 12 months, what methods have you used to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) In-person/face-to-face
If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Requested a medication or refill
If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Made an appointment
If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Contacted your case manager
If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Contacted a mental health provider
If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Contacted your HIV providers
If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Viewed lab results

If you have used to communicate with your HIV health care team within an app or online portal, have you done the following with this app or online portal? Communicated with other people living with HIV
What are your preferred method(s) to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) App or online portal (for example, MyChart)
What are your preferred method(s) to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Phone call
What are your preferred method(s) to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Text message
What are your preferred method(s) to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Email
What are your preferred method(s) to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) In person/face-to-face
What are your preferred method(s) to communicate with your HIV healthcare team? (Check all that apply) Other
If OTHER, please specify your preferred method to communicate with your HIV healthcare team.
